metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4622 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The create_pit_timer function in arch/x86/kvm/i8254.c in KVM 83, andpossibly other versions, does not properly handle when ProgrammableInterval Timer (PIT) interrupt requests (IRQs) when a virtual interruptcontroller (irqchip) is not available, which allows local users to cause adenial of service (NULL pointer dereference) by starting a timer.BUG: unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at0000000000000128IP: [<ffffffffa10f6280>] kvm_set_irq+0x30/0x170 [kvm]...Call Trace: [<ffffffffa11228c1>] pit_do_work+0x51/0xd0 [kvm] [<ffffffff81071431>] process_one_work+0x111/0x4d0 [<ffffffff81071bb2>] worker_thread+0x152/0x340 [<ffffffff81075c8e>] kthread+0x7e/0x90 [<ffffffff815a4474>] kernel_thread_helper+0x4/0x10

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.0-1.9').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
